Welcome to our travel blog, where adventure meets inspiration! Here, our team of seasoned travelers share their journeys, tips, advice and insider secrets to make your travels unforgettable. From off-the-beaten-path destinations to practical travel advice, explore a world of insights designed to inspire and guide your next adventure.

Meet Sahar Jamal

Hello, I'm Sahar Jamal! As a cultural heritage consultant and travel blogger, I’m on a mission to uncover the rich tapestry of human stories woven into the places we visit. From ancient ruins to bustling markets, my travels are driven by a deep respect for history, a passion for anthropology, and an adventurous spirit. Join me and my family as we wander the world, exploring heritage sites, tasting new flavors, and connecting with people who bring these places to life. Through my blog, I hope to inspire you to travel more meaningfully and embrace the stories waiting to be discovered.

  • Curious
  • Adventurous
  • Organized
  • Empathetic

More About Sahal

Sahar was born in Kabul, Afghanistan, and moved to Istanbul, Turkey, with her family about 10 years ago. She works as a cultural heritage consultant, helping to preserve and promote the rich history and traditions of various regions. Sahar enjoys documenting her travels and sharing the cultural stories she encounters on her blog.

  • Age

  • Gender

Interest

  • History
  • Cultural Anthropology

Hobbies

  • Travel Blogging
  • Reading Historical Novels
  • Exploring Local Markets
  • Hiking
  • Writing Style

    Engaging and informative with a personal touch. Aisha likes to incorporate cultural insights and practical tips into her travel stories.

  • Target Audience

    Young professionals and families who are interested in cultural experiences and practical travel tips.

  • Travel Style

    Typically travels with family

Travel Essentials

  • Notebook for travel notes
  • DSLR camera
  • Portable charger
  • A small sketchbook
  • Comfortable walking shoes
  • Local phrasebook or translation app
  • Reusable water bottle
  • Lightweight shawl (for visiting cultural sites)

Travel tips

  • Always learn a few key phrases in the local language; it helps build a connection with locals.

  • Respect local customs and dress appropriately, especially in culturally significant places.

  • Pack light but bring essentials – comfortable shoes and a reliable water bottle are musts.

  • Embrace early mornings to experience popular sites without the crowds.

  • Keep a flexible itinerary; the best experiences often come from unexpected detours.

Recent photos by our writers

My Travel Highlights

  • Travel Highlight

    Visiting Kyoto, Japan during the cherry blossom season and participating in a traditional tea ceremony with a local family, who shared stories of their ancestry and cultural heritage.

  • Favourite Destination

    Kyoto, Japan

  • Best Hotel

    Amangiri in Utah, USA – the serene, desert surroundings and minimalist design made it a peaceful retreat where she could truly connect with nature.

  • Adventurous Destination

    Hiking in the Pamir Mountains along the Afghanistan-Tajikistan border, where she explored remote villages and connected with locals who shared their cultural traditions.

  • Food Destination

    Istanbul, Turkey, where she explored local street food and traditional Ottoman recipes with a rich blend of spices and flavors.

My Bucket List

  • Machu Pichu Cusco, Peru
  • Petra Jordan
  • Angkor Wat Jordan
  • Great Wall of China China
  • Pyramids of Giza Egypt

TRavel diary: A trip across FRANCE

Discover the beauty and diversity of France with its stunning landscapes, and vibrant cultures.

  • 27 June 2024
  • Aisha Rahimi
  • Destination:
    Paris, France
  • Start:
    10 Feb 2025
  • End:
    16 Feb 2025
  • Duration:
    15 days
  • With:
    Family

Today was a delightful blend of art, history, and gastronomy as we immersed ourselves in the heart of Nice. The day started with a visit to [Villa Masséna Musée] a magnificent museum showcasing the rich heritage of the region. The exhibits were a fascinating journey through time, offering insights into the cultural tapestry of Nice.
After a morning filled with art appreciation, we headed to [Musée du Palais Lascaris] a stunning palace-turned-museum that left us in awe of its grandeur. The intricate architecture and priceless artifacts transported us back to a bygone era, making it a truly memorable experience.

Exploring France

Today was a delightful blend of art, history, and gastronomy as we immersed ourselves in the heart of Nice. The day started with a visit to [Villa Masséna Musée] a magnificent museum showcasing the rich heritage of the region. The exhibits were a fascinating journey through time, offering insights into the cultural tapestry of Nice.
After a morning filled with art appreciation, we headed to [Musée du Palais Lascaris] a stunning palace-turned-museum that left us in awe of its grandeur. The intricate architecture and priceless artifacts transported us back to a bygone era, making it a truly memorable experience.

  • Day 7: Shopping with the family

    Discover practical tips on how to balance work commitments while traveling, especially for those in demanding jobs like software engineering.

    27th June 2024
    View full article
  • Discover the beauty and diversity of Nice with its stunning landscapes

    Our second day in Kyoto unfolded like a gentle whisper of tranquility amidst the vibrant tapestry of Japan's cultural heart. The morning sun painted the sky with hues of gold as we set off to explore the iconic Arashiyama Bamboo Forest. As a cultural heritage consultant, the allure of this serene sanctuary was irresistible to me. The towering bamboo stalks, swaying gracefully in the breeze, felt like ancient guardians of a world forgotten by time.

  • Discover the beauty and diversity of Nice with its stunning landscapes

    We began our day with a delightful breakfast at Yasakadori Enraku, a charming little spot that served traditional Japanese fare. The warmth of the miso soup and the delicate flavors of the pickled vegetables were a comforting start, especially as I watched Laila and Omar eagerly try their first bowl of natto. Their curious expressions brought a smile to my face, reminding me of my own childhood adventures back in Kabul.

  • Discover the beauty and diversity of Nice with its stunning landscapes

    Strolling through the Arashiyama Bamboo Forest was akin to stepping into a living painting. The soft rustle of the bamboo leaves created a natural symphony that accompanied our footsteps. Amin, with his architect's eye, marveled at the natural architecture of the forest, while Laila captured the moment through her lens, each photograph a testament to her budding passion for photography.\n\nOur journey continued to Tenryu-ji, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most important Zen temples in Kyoto. The temple's gardens, meticulously designed and harmonious with nature, provided a perfect backdrop for quiet reflection. I found myself lost in thought, contemplating the seamless blend of nature and spirituality that defines so much of Japanese culture.

GO TO Day 1 Shopping with the family
GO TO Day 2 A flight back home
A Trip across France
A Trip across France

Nice, a stunning coastal city on the French Riviera, is a perfect blend of Mediterranean charm and cultural richness. Travelers can stroll along the famous Promenade des Anglais, explore the vibrant markets of Old Town, and bask in the sun on the pebble beaches.
